intro: Nitrophila australis var. australis, commonly known as the Australian nitrophila, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branched. Nitrophila australis var. australis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
